channel.title: The History or RSPS!?
channel.description:
Well i think Runescape private servers are slowly going to die, i have my reason's i cant be botherd to explain each one but im going to make a list on whats happening and whats gona happen
RuneScape Private Servers wont be here for very long.
[b]As you all know back 3 years ago know one knew what RSPS was? there was only Blake and a few coders, we all used WL..[/b]
Now we have things like delta, silabs, etc.. Yeh, there all based of WL, but are ruined i think .which is good but if you understand in the long run.
Servers are not what they are today like they where 1 year back, now 80% of the community are making them? more people are figuring that making there own server is better then playing a server..? so what does that leave us with? our servers are getting empty by the day? more people are making servers more people are buying VPS then ever.
Last year there where like only 6 servers which where 24-7, know look on the status page, you get 5 pages of servers on VPS and 100% uptime, theres just not enough people to play on our servers, they decide to make their own instead..
Well i want you guys to discuss about this, if you agree with me or not.

[/quote]

jesus fucking hell read the date[/quote]
I just did my calendar says 6/13/2012 on my computer

anyways…
That server linked in this topic sounded interesting
Too bad all the links are dead

item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote="_ikram, post:15, topic:281836"][quote author=blakeman8192 link=topic=372441.msg2817083#msg2817083 date=1244348570]
I do believe that the progressive development boom that was occurring during the birth of WinterLove is no longer in existence today - there is only so much people can code to a server, and it has all already been done (with crappy code that makes winterlove crash, but still). I think it will take something big to reincarnate the original excitement we all had during the birth of our community, we have reached our bright future, and it is not bright because we have taken shortcuts along the way. It will take some huge revolutionary community project to get us rolling back to the speed (or even faster) that we were previously at.
[/quote]

I agree with you[/quote]

Then why dont we do one?
WE have the tools that drop box program is rather helpful
A lot of us have the skill
And we have the power and the time. The only thing is we would have to carefully pick the people involved. Also the server would have to be released into the public at the end which I guess is why most people wouldnt do it.

Read full topic

item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“The cook from runescape, post:20, topic:281836”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=372441.msg2817517#msg2817517 date=1244381231]

Here is a graph which summaries the progress of private servers:

thats a poor graph, and shows nothing, it in fact shows progress is going backwards and forwards, and time should always be the independant variable( ie on the x axis)
[/quote]

Yeh I agree it doesn’t make much sense. [it seemed to when I thought it up]

It’s supposed to indicate the side-stepping in development.[/quote]
it would do that if it didnt wave it shows progress going backwards, you could have the rate at which progress is being made and i suppose then it would make sense, except for the fact time would have to change axis

Read full topic

item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar, post:12, topic:281836”]Look at what silab did to moparscape(not saying it is bad)

i remember playing on a server called hippiescape (downloaded)
And i saw skillcapes on there irl i was like “omfgwtfbbq”
and so i tried to spawn them and i got nulls!
1 hour later i see a client called “silab”,i read about it and
it was a client that had the models for the new items…

so i downloaded it with my slow computer!yay!..wait NO!
so then i logged in and spawn a attack cape and hood and
then was amazed omfg holy sh–

2 days later,silab was popular
2 weeks later silab was VERY well known
2 months later,80% of servers had silab items
1 year later deltascape sources came,more models
more items…so on,
2 months later MORE AND MORE DELTA

2009+ delta was overused,no more old servers
no more object training
delta was leeched,80%of servers used it to much
and so on…
still leeched servers…

Really look whats happened people…
It was silabs fault 0.0…[/quote]No more objects training? Ever heard of Back to Basics? My server base.

Anyway, no, they won’t die. Face it; they’ve been around for 3 years and are only getting bigger. There’s many other communities out there that have more going on than MoparScape.

Read full topic

item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @_ikram _ikram
item.description:
@_ikram wrote:

blakeman8192:

I do believe that the progressive development boom that was occurring during the birth of WinterLove is no longer in existence today - there is only so much people can code to a server, and it has all already been done (with crappy code that makes winterlove crash, but still). I think it will take something big to reincarnate the original excitement we all had during the birth of our community, we have reached our bright future, and it is not bright because we have taken shortcuts along the way. It will take some huge revolutionary community project to get us rolling back to the speed (or even faster) that we were previously at.

I agree with you

Read full topic

I think it will take something big to reincarnate the original excitement we all had during the birth of our community, we have reached our bright future, and it is not bright because we have taken shortcuts along the way. item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar, post:12, topic:281836”]Look at what silab did to moparscape(not saying it is bad)

i remember playing on a server called hippiescape (downloaded)
And i saw skillcapes on there irl i was like “omfgwtfbbq”
and so i tried to spawn them and i got nulls!
1 hour later i see a client called “silab”,i read about it and
it was a client that had the models for the new items…

so i downloaded it with my slow computer!yay!..wait NO!
so then i logged in and spawn a attack cape and hood and
then was amazed omfg holy sh–

2 days later,silab was popular
2 weeks later silab was VERY well known
2 months later,80% of servers had silab items
1 year later deltascape sources came,more models
more items…so on,
2 months later MORE AND MORE DELTA

2009+ delta was overused,no more old servers
no more object training
delta was leeched,80%of servers used it to much
and so on…
still leeched servers…

Really look whats happened people…
It was silabs fault 0.0…[/quote]

95% of the servers here are based off wL, therefor they are all ‘leeched’. Also, object training was shit, and they’re also not ‘silab items’.

[quote=“Newty, post:5, topic:281836”][quote author=_ikram link=topic=372441.msg2810363#msg2810363 date=1243962868]

You know nothing of the history of this site, or RSPS for that matter.

“Delta, silabs, etc” are all based off of winterLove.

Our server’s now, such as; Shards, 317Serv, rs2dv are 100x more stable then winterlove server’s.

This community is not dieing, it has stages. During 9 months of the year, we lose members, then during the summer months our community get’s a ton of new user’s. It has been like that since the beginning.

When did i say the community is dieng? im saying SERVERS wont last very long, i dont care how stable they are compared to WL, More people are making servers, what do we host now? where loosing players daily…? more people getting vps…
[/quote]

Survival of the fittest. The most popular, stable, and content rich server’s will survive.[/quote]

Not really, most of the popular servers these days are shitty servers based of wL, that’s how it may end up, but for now, it’s looking like the shittiest prevail.

Read full topic

more items…so on,
2 months later MORE AND MORE DELTA

2009+ delta was overused,no more old servers
no more object training
delta was leeched,80%of servers used it to much
and so on…
still leeched servers…

Really look whats happened people…
It was silabs fault 0.0…

item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @zoltanman zoltanman
item.description:
@zoltanman wrote:

As long as the communities average age stays low, the level of programming knowledge stays low. A lot of people know the code will be given to them, so they just sit and wait and learn nothing. So we haven’t progressed really at all, only certain people have.

Read full topic

item.title: The History or RSPS!?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

[quote=“jc22493, post:7, topic:281836”][quote author=Newty link=topic=372441.msg2810364#msg2810364 date=1243962940]

You know nothing of the history of this site, or RSPS for that matter.

“Delta, silabs, etc” are all based off of winterLove.

Our server’s now, such as; Shards, 317Serv, rs2dv are 100x more stable then winterlove server’s.

This community is not dieing, it has stages. During 9 months of the year, we lose members, then during the summer months our community get’s a ton of new user’s. It has been like that since the beginning.

When did i say the community is dieng? im saying SERVERS wont last very long, i dont care how stable they are compared to WL, More people are making servers, what do we host now? where loosing players daily…? more people getting vps…

Survival of the fittest. The most popular servers will survive.
[/quote]
Fixt. No one cares about stability.[/quote]

True that.

Read full topic
